comment.author: 11953092@N04
comment._content: Percy Haughton Ellis actually first served with the Gloucestershire Regiment entering France as 2nd LT on 24 May 1916. He joined them from the Inns of Court OTC on 16th January 1916. www.london-gazette.co.uk/issues/29445/pages/859 He later transferred to the Middlesex Regiment ending the war as a Captain. His address in 1921 was Cobham, Surrrey.

comment.author: 11953092@N04
comment._content: Interestingly Ellis was discussed in Parliament in a question raised by Lieut-Colonel Hon. Cuthbert James on 13 July 1920. It seems Ellis was discharged in 1919 due to wounds. His rank was Captain, however he was paid his gratuity as a lieutenant due to small print hansard.millbanksystems.com/commons/1920/jul/13/10th-midd...
